title: What 80s soundtrack songs from popular movies are really great but were overshadowed by another hit song on the same soundtrack? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ok. Well I seem to remember a film that had a song that overshadowed other decent songs on the same soundtrack.  Beverly Hills Cop. It actually had several good songs. But the one that stood out the most from this film didn’t even have lyrics. Axel F performed by Harold Faltermeyer. This song was huge in the mid 80s. It was played all the time. It’s still probably the most recognized song from the film. And it’s instrumental. Keyboards only.https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=Qx2gvHjNhQ0 Other good songs that got air time are… The Heat is On by Glenn Fry.https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=uZD8HKVKneINeutron Dance by the Pointer Sistershttps://m.youtube.com/watch?v=SOscjUHPY-oNew Attitude by Patti Labell.https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=QWfZ5SZZ4xEThese three songs still got decent airtime. But Axel F is the most well known. One great song that got lost in the shuffle was Gratitude by Danny Elfman. At the time he was still part of Oingo Boingo. Gratitude was a catchy song and is better than the song Weird Science, which is probably Oingo Boingo’s most well known song, followed by Dead Man’s Party….a Halloween favorite. Gratitude was an 80’s alternative dance tune which should be more recognized today. It’s one of Oingo Boingo’s best songs. But Weird Science and Dead Man’s Party tend to suck all the air out of the room. Gratitude was also on the soundtrack and was actually my favorite song to listen to. I played it over and over again. https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=0_nDVjykgDk
I’m Free (Heaven Helps The Man) is one of my all-time favorite ‘80s songs, but it’s overshadowed by the title song.
